challengeMain.body: The Museum needed a secure, off-site, cloud-accessible, and easily managed solution to protect its one-of-a-kind, irreplaceable footage. Storing the only master copy locally presented a high risk of losing all assets in the event of a data failure or system crash.
challengeMain.featuredStat1Body: of data is safely stored and accessible for the Museum.
challengeMain.item1Body: The Museum also needed assistance with physical storage for a collection of historical music artifacts.
challengeMain.item2Body: The former digital storage system was slow and inefficient, especially for remote access, which frustrated staff when they needed to retrieve content quickly.
challengeMain.featuredStat2Body: of existing footage of data migration from physical drives into Iron Mountain’s digital preservation platform.

solutionMain.headline: A partnership with Iron Mountain
solutionMain.body: With a focus on physical storage and a secure digital archive, Iron Mountain provided climate-controlled, private vaults for physical artifacts and implemented a robust repository for digital preservation.
numberedList: Digitized 786 videotapes (e.g., DVCPRO, Beta SP, MiniDV)
Restored 33 hard drives (67 TB) featuring GRAMMY Award shows
Stored 1,000 cubic feet total of physical, historic assets in climate-controlled, private vaults

solutionGrid.headline: How Iron Mountain’s digital preservation platform works:

valueMain.headline: Expanding possibilities
valueMain.body: The partnership with Iron Mountain secured the Museum's legacy, dramatically improving its preservation workflow and content accessibility for future generations.

diamondBenefits.label: Operational benefits
bullets: Improved accessibility and security of the museum's assets
Simplified and made remote access efficient, allowing authorized users to access and distribute content quickly from anywhere
Post-production workflow includes automatic, immediate upload of footage to a digital preservation platform

diamondBenefits.label: Economical benefits
bullets: Enhanced licensing opportunities due to the ability to easily retrieve original, high-resolution content, including multiple camera angles

diamondBenefits.label: Strategic benefits
bullets: Safely archived and protected unique performances against on-site disasters
Positioned the museum for future innovation through Iron Mountain’s upcoming enhancements to its digital preservation platform, including generative AI for advanced search capabilities

ambient.headline: The GRAMMY MuseumⓇ preserves the soundtrack of history.
ambient.quoteSource: - Michael Rohrabacher,  Technical Director at the GRAMMY Museum
ambient.subheader: "It’s been a pleasure working with Iron Mountain. We feel very confident that the GRAMMY Museum’s physical artifacts and digital content are safely protected. Iron Mountain’s digital preservation platform also provides significant reassurance that our iconic artist performances and interviews will remain preserved and accessible, which is a huge benefit to the GRAMMY Museum.”
ambient.title: Rich media & cultural heritage

customInteractive1.headline: Learn more about how we unlocked new possibilities for our partners
customInteractive1.body2: Explore each section to learn how Iron Mountain can transform your enterprise

diamondCarouselItems.ModalBody: Assets, whether film, audio, digital, or physical, are logged, evaluated for condition and risk, and prioritized based on preservation and activation potential.
Physical media is digitized to archival standards, with restoration applied as needed and metadata extracted to ensure assets are searchable, playable, and accessible.
Iron Mountain's digital preservation platform provides a fully managed digital repository with triple-redundant geo-distributed storage, secure access, and intuitive navigation.
The entire archive becomes searchable through AI-powered metadata, custom filters, and integrated preview tools, enabling fast discovery from any location.
Digitized content is ready for licensing, streaming, and storytelling, unlocking new value across platforms while maintaining archival integrity.
